intro: Schleidenia parciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered Schlöderia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Schleidenia parciflora is often found in mountainous regions and is considered a rare and endemic species.
